PHASE SUMMARY — Jacques Paganel — early

Role: 
- Introduced as a passenger on the Duncan
- Identified as Jacques Paganel, a geographer and secretary of the Geographical Society
- Has a mission from the Geographical Society and letters from Lord Somerset to the governor-general of India

Traits:
- Grandiloquent (speaks with a lofty animation and is carried away by his imagination)
- Modest (despite his grandiloquence, he is described as an agreeable person)
- Possibly obsessive (repeatedly says "The Duncan! the Duncan!")

Relationships:
- Lord Glenarvan: knows Paganel's name and merit, and is familiar with his geographical labors
- Captain Mangles: addressed by Paganel
- Miss Grant: addressed by Paganel
- Lady Helena: addressed by Paganel
- Lord Somerset: Paganel has letters from him

Notable behaviors:
- Introduces himself to Lord Glenarvan and other passengers
- Speaks at length about his mission and geographical labors
- Becomes woeful and humble after realizing his baggage is on board
- Repeatedly says "The Duncan! the Duncan!"
- Examines the rigging of the yacht and questions the horizon of the open sea
